document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

EA88F8EB93714B9D96D0728557FB0AD9.description:
Recognize that the Sacraments are key moments that
give us grace to witness to our faith.

5FA7170F97844A1B83A042E15FB4161C.description:
Articulate that all people are made in the image and
likeness of God and express their belief in God in different ways.

C499BA02333E41DD8CF723F74B449B95.description: Define ecumenism as the call to Christian unity.

58D3503810634302ABCC79418B4CA18B.description:
CALL
TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION [848-849,927-
933,95,2044,2472]

BE2BA950E65B4F9DBC32C11425055491.description:
Define steward through the understanding of donating
one’s time, talent, and treasure.

6AF88AFE9A5F4518A2BE0F234E755519.description:
List ways that one is called to respond as a responsible
steward, given the knowledge that all creation is sacred.

9BA6C03B5FB64E9A85AABED90D006EEC.description:
Participate with their class in discerning the gifts of their
classroom community and in giving thanks for these gifts.

56505C5B2CCF4A23AD8105A388D982EA.description: Care for the gift of our bodies.

820E642E71874788B4E043EA66FA16F1.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
social teaching about
the common good
[2419-2422]

4002CFF02D594421820AAC46DCE1061A.description:
Articulate understand that all Christians follow Jesus as
the Way, the Truth and the Life.

18A551CDB9F64AED806666A6D40C281F.description:
Demonstrate ways that the grace received in the
sacraments can help you witness your faith in your daily life.

95B6742C76904478B1CA2427644D53AA.description:
Increase understanding of discipleship as following
Jesus and living out the Gospel message – Mt. 28 – The Great Mandate
to go forth.

E0763AD4D0EF41EDADE445ECE77D6A10.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816-849]
Scripture
Mt. 9:10-13; 28:16-20
Mk. 16:15-18
1 Sam. 3:1-10
1 Kings 3:4-15

5E0356EC098B4DBC9CFA80DCE3B3E6A3.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6: THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

50ECE83BC08E4027BE475DA4A5A33017.description: Celebrate days in honor of Mary; pray Marian prayers.

120CD6A097C2473E9CFA0CB4261B7ECB.description:
Understand the implications of Mary’s “Yes!” to God’s will as
a model for our lives.

6A8327BCAEE94F2491075A79566532CD.description:
Articulate the titles and symbols of Mary. (Resource: Litany
of Loreto)

171BAA4A97714D20938D78D5BB607DAB.description:
MARY AS MODEL OF
CHURCH
[148-149, 963-975,
2673-2682]
Scripture
Lk. 1:26-55
Jn. 19:25-27

519E14BE748F488884F3F343576F4963.description:
Identify, research and describe several selected Saints from
different historical periods in the Church, share how their lives are examples
of God’s call to service, explain their appreciation for the sacraments and
reflect on how their lives fostered the growth of the Church.

85BF2A728F1848F69A01A95CD7D8E5DB.description:
Identify several Saints who devoted themselves to the
sacramental life of the Church and inspire us to lead good lives.

1F97AD2D5B8140C7A2704598308BAA99.description:
Recognize the particular charism of religious communities
within a parish.

289B956B51144C44BC0A72B9F339332C.description: Realize that saints come from all walks of life.

9074A89420504640909432717FFF732B.description:
Be familiar with the story of the parish patron saint and celebrate
the feast day.

EA9188F0B90B4ED597348744C0508FDF.description: Pray for the diocesan (archdiocesan) seminarians by name.

0A64F42B3FE94551AB5709DC5EF324D9.description:
Recognize God’s call to be ordained: deacon, priest,
bishop.

AC21AEF057C842F1A74F998C11A29437.description:
Recognize the vocation to consecrated life and provide
examples of this calling.

10315E670B2E4A12BCEEB50D949E1472.description:
Identify the Sacraments of Vocation/Service and explain how
ordained and married persons are called to proclaim, serve, and witness.

00CB22585B5E48CBBF513CC7D5E62947.description:
Identify qualities of people who joyfully live out the vocation of
Marriage.

5DC24526E8424EA2B1C14123E10DB5E9.description:
VOCATION:
MARRIAGE,
PRIESTHOOD,
RELIGIOUS LIFE
[914-933]
Scripture
Gen. 12:1-9
Gen. 3:1-10

4A2FA3B1BFB54E21AE49AE97650908BD.description:
Describe how participation in the sacraments help us lead a
holy life.

22E470704E12422E8FA96403FF03DBA8.description:
THE
UNIVERSAL CALL TO
HOLINESS
[2013-2014,2028,2813]
Scripture
Lev. 11:44
Eph. 1:3-4; 4:1-6
Pet. 1:15-16

94AAC9F5B682407D96692F0B4A9E9E08.description:
Identify how the Kingdom of God is lived out in families
(domestic church), their parish, the local Church, Archdiocese and the
universal Church.

14737EE57E9046428F88BA7403D22132.description:
Explain the concept of the domestic church as the place
where children receive the first proclamation of the faith.

9795D2C3833C4521AB6A85653F2AEC42.description:
The Domestic Church
[1655-58, 1666, 2204-
2257, 2685]
Scripture
Ex. 20:12
Mt. 15:4

2FB2F6B3EBDD4CF785930B1B1FE49310.description:
Define how we share in the priestly, prophetic and kingly
offices of the Church.

B86F3FFC37DF4664866A97B7B3A9811F.description:
Explain how the Precepts of the Church can encourage us
to worship more fully as a community.

D43473D9FE534088970F7D5C0317D83B.description:
Church
Order: The HierarchyMagisterium
and
Infallibility
[874-896]
Scripture
Ex. 2:1-10; 24; 3:1-17;
12:1-28; 14: 5-29; 16:1-
35; 19:16-20:17; 24:1-12

C77FE5A678524CABBCCCBF1E707644EB.description:
Associate the Sacraments as special events in the life of the
Church that help identify her as one, holy, catholic and apostolic.

9D7A64B412834829BD294E11C4737902.description:
Explain how the four marks of the Church help us build the
Kingdom of God.

721B945AC6B140E59E894370B8E6FEAE.description:
THE
MYSTERY AND MARKS
OF THE CHURCH:
One, Holy, Catholic,
and Apostolic
[811-870]

69F5661C95F04B54A8E6BDA458226730.description:
Associate the presence of the Holy Spirit within us and the
importance of chastity.

2FDF398F113C4FD7BA6D94AF316AE47A.description:
Temple of
the Holy Spirit
[797-801]
Scripture
1 Cor 6:19-20

23FADE16A5E549428C9348E20AFD7620.description:
Recognize we are all members of the Body of Christ and are
called to work together to build the Kingdom of God.

E71EA270EAD3445A933DFD579F312B8E.description: Identify the church as the Mystical Body of Christ on earth.

18E4ADB43B9940AF88636A4175A84FC8.description:
Identify ways to show respect for all members of a
community.

20B30C385FCE4FBFA3E63A79342BE7FD.description:
Identify ways that the Sacraments offer grace filled opportunities
and encouragement to join together, worship God, and serve God’s people.

4BB22E68044A4D1B98692167632D670E.description:
Explain how the Sacraments tie us to the History of the Church;
the Kingdom of God is both here and yet to come.

E3E2A45B3C0C43FFB5A3FFC2416F4774.description:
THE CHURCH
IN GOD’S PLAN
[748-780]
Church History
[758-780]

9BB59DFF45B04B0DA73EBA1252D0BB76.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5: THE LIFE, COMMUNITY AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of
Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

7BB81D848EAD4A0595E3598FCC345F25.description: Agnus Dei / Behold the Lamb of God

F8C27E9FF26C4E00A67EACCA3AADCAC8.description: Responses after Scripture: Readings and Gospel

36D5E185599348FE921AF0314625D848.description: Spontaneous Prayer using “You, Who, Do Through” sequence

5F0A6C80A8424F3FAC36ADADF5E927AC.description:
Invitatory, Psalm(s) antiphonal style and Doxology from the Liturgy
of the Hours – Psalm 139

DE92D06F912C4DDB9E1AC042309CEF2B.description: One or more decades of the Rosary

42C24EF8002F4AF8BA07F5F21C4E13AD.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise, intercession, thanksgiving,
petition

3DF8110971F040498123E7C0C9CE8B26.description: Prayer for Souls of the Faithful Departed

2AB4A35F6A4C44DA969842415F9B7A52.description:
PRAYERS WE
KNOW BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

50767496EE2E47B184A8D1DB4927408E.description: Articulate the history and purpose of the Rosary.

B1D8D4C69CCF4A7CB9FC3EDCB89B2066.description:
Know by heart and find references for the Joyful Mysteries:
Baptism of Jesus, Marriage Feast at Cana, Jesus Announces the Kingdom of
God, Last Supper

F1A22C3EC6FE4E05986FA79DBC526B0F.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas)
[1200-1209, 1674-1679,
2683-2696]

97ABD8BAF55A49B28D700B600890FC4B.description: Explain when and why the “Our Father” is prayed during the liturgy.

E71BDE6BAA7C463CBD8598EBA637E664.description: Recite and illustrate understanding of the “Our Father.”

77C588BD8BEB4B95999D96617AE95935.description:
OUR FATHER:
Summary of the Gospel
[2746-2865]
Scripture
Mt. 6:5-15
Lk. 11:1-13

80B0B9E100B74D8C8FAC351EEE372EB8.description: Engage in four stages of Lectio Divina.

81274AB110CD4D0FB6F96966FF4F720E.description: Participate in a variety of traditional devotions.

A9B4D48FFF77486398F78E705C143A23.description: Describe how the Jesus prayer can help them in their daily lives.

4EC2681B9B8E4749AB06F5E2D28A120E.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF
PRAYER (vocal
meditation,
contemplation,
personal and share)
[2700-2724]

243723BAE5024744AD45B71EEB8D5ED9.description:
Know the Liturgy of the Hours is comprised of Psalms from the
Old Testament.

A2EB5B6F50CD48C3ADCD670BCEBF3018.description:
Understand the Psalms as prayers that formed part of the prayer
life of Jesus and the Apostles.

E880166081174F0B928A2318376198AA.description:
Demonstrate the ability to identify the various forms of prayer,
blessing, adoration, petition, intercession, thanksgiving, and praise.

958521B0D3D34579B8D002A35D6EAA53.description:
FORMS OF PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-10
Lk. 1:46-55

646609D815B14BDAA59679F104E71F10.description: Describe ways to prepare for prayer.

E24624BB9AFB40E9925BF59B47AD4199.description:
Demonstrate a reverential attitude for prayer and the value of
silence in prayer.

62C29421F0444D69AD03A899DBF7E832.description: Describe what it means to pray.

BF78D745F38545A5BA62D4BB1E0216B6.description:
THE UNIVERSAL
CALL TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]

D34F4A5D6C0241448C18531FBB766B35.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

8CD38F0336AB43289F507F163C76A951.description:
Participate in service projects and reflect on how service
continues in building the Kingdom of God on earth.

A40204A557754B6295D279F7D6D12C32.description:
Determine ways to show appreciation for jobs of those in local
community.

8BDDDD3AD4DA44FB814F5797F400873F.description:
Evaluate how homework and home/classroom responsibilities
help build respect for the value of work.

3B0CEF202D8946909C9D462AB8E6531A.description: Identify ways to show respect for the work of others.

8B5AFFD44F9D4DADADEFB17D6FE08565.description: Associate every right with a corresponding responsibility.

524362E3713C44F5AF4F599CC45097D4.description:
Relate Catholic Social Teachings with Jesus’ life and
teachings.

7EE81AD16C0A4517BD53F335FEBD701B.description:
Define Catholic Social Teachings and how living these
teachings can reduce social sin.

5DE9D2ECC32B4938919F024322D9E12D.description:
Understand what it means to be good stewards of God’s
creation.

F0EE7D07D92D45C5B6A2646901B12AC6.description:
Catholic
Social Teachings –
Consistent Ethic of
Life, Love of Neighbor,
and Corporal and
Spiritual Works of
Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Rth. 1:1-22; 3:1-4:17

6A0A7B3739934F91895EEF4E58219E60.description:
Define solidarity and Identify challenges to achieving this in our
society.

ED14AA2079CC4565B47B7CC096B87C6C.description:
Identify ways to alleviate problems of hunger, disease, poverty
due to social sin.

7526EF3C7024447096AFEB21C547DDE9.description:
Explore the terms social sin and associate this term with a
problem in our society

AD5035CCD3B041F09CB5D53448125AC9.description:
Identify and explain the similarities and differences in the
concepts of hell and purgatory.

F2E2C426A360435EBDD172A0932EC7F8.description:
Understand the importance of praying for the “souls of the
faithfully departed.” (See prayers.)

1D712710E2AA486FB81CB0EF9368D767.description:
Recall examples of sinful actions and explain the consequences
of choosing to sin.

9F3045DF07C34360AC21F524B701180B.description:
Personal
and Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture
Gen. 2-3
2 Mac. 12:38-46

3A9FB70BABD04D949203C1B5E82C3E3F.description:
Identify current events that illustrate an injustice and lack of
respect for the sacramental presence in each person.

03292C0FA55C4E61BC200760173B2CD1.description:
Show respect and care for the sacramental presence in each
person.

2DAB4FFC5A2544339FC8EDEC9E94A90B.description:
Experience the sacraments as both a personal and communal way
of deepening our life in Christ.

534E3814C3FE4955976F2DABFDF81D13.description: Recite and demonstrate ways to practice Theological Virtues.

3174D166C16D4B3ABD21B10BEB20C21B.description:
List the Cardinal Virtues and explain their effects on the life of
a Christian.

CFF9EF1BEB7E47D69005DB79F6C212A2.description:
Virtues:
Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture
Lk. 1:26-38; 6:20-26
Mt. 18:21-35

235D2BCC441E40C7A07C793693EC7D45.description:
Explain the implications of God’s covenant with the People of
God.

E0E20757F5174C30AEA34188B7FFD81C.description:
State the two Great Commandments and identify how each of
the sacraments assists us following the Commandments.

5E39FFBB09474FA8BAA183270AD9ADFE.description:
Name the Ten Commandments and describe situations that
would break a commandment.

A5B71A950203430DA86616B93079657A.description:
Covenant
and the Ten
Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture
Ex. 19:16-20:17; 24:1-12
Mt. 22:34:-40
Mk. 12:28-34

6BC6EE81BF1447538C990BAC45C85D95.description:
Understand and explain how Reconciliation, received with the
right disposition, frees us from sins committed after Baptism.

9B124DE351864C248E5BA021C380B916.description:
Recognize the necessary conditions for sin and its
consequences.

F7713ADADD78441280D11CCABEE87870.description: Explain consequences of making sinful choices.

EE315D18E7294D1885659C914CCC5956.description:
Describe why sin offends God and neighbor and is a failure to
love.

B58FB99A1D164B23B2FE9664EAC78B22.description:
Identify the part in the Mass where we are asked to examine
our conscience.

10C000E737D1430CA787D54695561EF4.description:
Demonstrate their knowledge of a method to examine their
conscience.

E908D20986E64E8B82568AC709510081.description:
Describe why and how formation of conscience is a vital part
of celebrating the Sacrament of Reconciliation.

93A5472957B1425786949C8CD0FE00B5.description:
Human
Freedom and
Conscience Formation
[1030-1037, 1730-1803]
Scripture
Gn. 3:1-24; 4:1-6; 11:1-9
Ex. 3:1-7
Rth. 1:1-22; 3:1-4:17
Est. 4:12-30
Job 38:1-41

8DC97785DCE643A18AFFC284740BCDAE.description:
Identify the four levels of happiness and how the Beatitudes
help us achieve happiness through the grace of God.

A4848E1C5486451AB10013A84589887A.description:
Identify the Eight Beatitudes as Jesus’ teaching about the
Kingdom and moral goodness.

14535086D032443AAA2BC4235C5C92E4.description:
Name the Beatitudes and describe how to practice them in
daily life.

5E5D735A5F3D4F149873690D75C6E02C.description: Recognize that moral life is a spiritual worship.

15C8A8DE5C18489581BBD6823383E66C.description:
Articulate that each human person has a soul that will live
forever.

D62477181727448BA5BCCA0E20B96550.description:
Recognize that the grace we receive in the sacraments
prepares our souls for eternal life with God. (sanctifying grace).

7C818FFF6D9643A48415BCEE674665CB.description: Understand to love is to will the good of another.

E71D9C8744AC45AFB4E5E3880B381309.description:
Made in the
image of God –
Foundation of Human
Dignity
[355-368,1004,1700-
1876]
Scripture
Gn. 1:1-2:3

4E82CE9371EC46618F7A38961D8BCD27.description:
Recognize that faith is a life-long journey where we are
strengthened by the grace of the Sacraments to fulfill God’s will for our lives.

3CC70660D2F3422C9C596EC491B76B2A.description:
Recognize that all people are created by God with a capacity to
know and respond to His will for our lives.

8E597BF9EE8E45C79A04CA76584CFE81.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3 – MORAL EDUCATION: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled in a
personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.

70D41E68EAD440718B8ECCE55A7F93A6.description:
Know the Sacrament of Matrimony signifies the union of
Christ and the Church, giving the spouses the grace to love one another with
the love with which Christ loved His Church.

D2038AE581BF4AFEB7EEA56784880B92.description:
Associate the Paschal Mystery with Christian funerals as dying
and rising to new life.

898A4E0775984DBD967922AC1564D7B0.description:
Liturgical
Rites: Weddings,
[1621-1637], Funerals
[988-1029, 1680-1690]
and Blessings
[1671-1673]

6F48BDCEC0FF4072A5BBA5AD7BCC2EAA.description: Experience the Liturgy of the Hours.

D43D2066E8834F2CB8139AB3706F89CD.description:
With the teacher and classmates, antiphonally recite and pray
Psalm 51.

3CF0039E4EBD474FB99351948C575D64.description:
As the teacher says, “God, come to my assistance,” make the
Sign of the Cross and respond, “Lord, make haste to help me.” Offer the
Glory Be/ Doxology for the Liturgy of the Hours. (See Prayers)

D9169B9D56524DA3AA271FD625A1FB40.description:
Divine Office
Liturgy of the Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalm 139, 95
Dn. 3:57-88 - Canticle
of Daniel

98D49E5810394C64A0EEBCD65AF5110F.description:
Incorporate sacramentals into daily life: rosaries, medals,
crucifixes, blessed ashes, blessed palms, and use of holy water.

9FC713D444FE4285B94CB57BAB4419E8.description:
Know and define sacred vessels, vestments, liturgical books,
liturgical environment and ministers used at Mass.

5229987126544C17B625E02179F3AD85.description:
Recognize and name the liturgical symbols and sacramentals
associated with each of the sacraments.

D456F8D98D534239B1783E116AFB530C.description:
Know the definition and effects of sacramental – holy objects
and actions.

F548E56F8DAD4E18891839E97576E345.description:
Liturgical
Symbols and
Sacramentals
[1179-1199, 1667-1679]
Scripture
Exodus

726B2D3B8A8E4D2A96150CE43FD806F1.description: Explain the liturgical calendar in own words.

EB6B1C4AA4034457BB0F878841871BDA.description:
Celebrate and participate in various seasons of the liturgical
year.

92AD3208D490438589C725B14FE24669.description: Articulate the names and colors of the liturgical year.

6B78363A40EF42C3BE256B7AFA051103.description: Recognize and list the degrees of Holy Orders.

A6085226272847FB99158218B8073992.description:
Articulate how the Sacrament of Marriage calls each spouse to
model the love of the Trinity.

20F3075D369849F792213EAF4B1B1F82.description:
Articulate how the Sacraments at the Service of Communion
are ways to serve God, the Church, and the broader human community.

4C08DBFA44E0403AA35C4F8D2ED993D2.description:
Sacraments at
the Service of
Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture
Gen. 15:1-21; 22:1-18
Song of Songs 2:6
Heb. 7:17-25

1F60E2327B8143E08B660501B6C3D3D4.description:
Identify the two Sacraments of Healing and connect each with
healing stories in the Gospels and from own experience.

807B21FF399B48A19961F6F528A7C571.description:
Describe the order and the essential elements and participate in
the sacrament of Penance/Reconciliation: examination of conscience,
confession, act of sorrow, resolution to not sin again, and absolution by a
priest.

932C3F8882AD4D729D7FE2B498825548.description:
Sacraments of
Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]
Scripture
Ex. 12:1-20
2 Sam 12: 7-15

002274DE47F84C4BAA78BD338838321E.description:
Know and articulate the effects, symbols, minister, how the
sacraments are celebrated and responsibilities flowing from receiving the
Sacraments of Initiation

BDBB8A6C63CF4EE08EC65317D040DEB5.description:
Demonstrate awareness of the Rite of Christian Initiation of
Adults (RCIA) process and terms such as candidate and catechumenate.

C8B5D9CFB9B8464CBC79790A370ECFEF.description: Explain the symbolism of the Baptismal Font and the Altar.

7200BAE5BCFE4907AB41833F50C4CFCD.description:
Sacraments of
Initiation
[966-977, 1212-1419]
Scripture
Ex. 12:1-20
Ex. 14:5-29; 16:1-35

CA0CFE16DBD04C1B86F1ACA10BA2C45B.description: Explain how each sacrament helps us to live as Christ taught.

B2B3247FE0704548AB36E4F666A71145.description:
Recognize that while sanctifying the individual person through the
sacraments, the communal celebration sanctifies all members of the Church
through God’s action and grace.

61154DA2BE0B4334AA2D1C42B05574B8.description:
Articulate how the Sacraments draw each closer to Jesus and
prepares each for life everlasting.

A66D206C85E74C17802088F01E7917B5.description:
Explain how regular participation in the Sacraments of Eucharist and
Reconciliation help us grow in virtue and holiness.

ADD901B812194BCEA0E0947E6EBC73B7.description: Explain why the sacraments are important to Catholics.

30958D8AF5644A688FE7A742183A3F07.description:
Understand how God’s sanctifying grace is revealed in the
sacraments.

28BDFA0654EA47C2B1B0C6DF71F59BE1.description:
Know the outward signs, symbols, rite, ministers and effects of
each sacrament.

CD50895C43564EE19CBE8C1356FB7AC3.description:
Recognize Christ’s great gift of the seven sacraments he has
given to the Catholic Church.

D6BD161F22314A49AC154A1968354B4D.description:
Recognize Christ’s great gift of the seven sacraments he has
given to the Catholic Church.

2BA75035708248A6B0A956E1DE26F8E2.description:
Recognize Christ’s great gift of the seven sacraments he has
given to the Catholic Church.

A9531350678C408694DAFDC9F427C5D4.description:
CELEBRATION
OF THE SEVEN
SACRAMENTS
[1210-1666]
Scripture
Gen. 6:9-9:17; 15:1-21
Ex. 16:1-35
Jn. 1:1-7; 6:32-58
1 Cor. 10:16-18
2 Cor. 4:1-6
1 Sam. 16:1-13

4740314FE3494241939399E33BB8EA44.description:
As a class, with guidance from the teacher, prepare a liturgy based
on a chosen theme or feast day, including choice of readings, creation of
intercessory prayers, and music.

F4431407564F4B8F80CA3C0704CEE733.description:
Participate fully in the Eucharist with liturgical gestures and
responses.

3921E5AAEA924187BC6C268A093BB329.description:
Recognize the Eucharist as the source and summit of our Catholic
faith.

ED9CB72759C742418746858B83517FCC.description:
Explain how, Jesus the Bread of Life, nourishes them in the
Eucharist.

B6CE3771145A4737AD159276CFFB5F44.description:
Appreciate and participate in worship of Eucharist at Mass and
devotions outside Mass such as Exposition and Benediction.

4310FAB5DFE54B93ABC36734203BF532.description: Explain the “sending forth” segment of the Mass.

C8AB1721AC9340AFB7F4A676E5A699F3.description:
Explain how the Body and Blood of Christ nourish us in the
Eucharist.

C8D9EDC4088A4E7FAE92B3A6025D1771.description:
Recall the term and concept of transubstantiation and associate it
with the Real Presence of Christ in the Sacrament of the Eucharist.

9CC3B5086B04482DBFCB6FCE4513BAD8.description: Describe the Eucharistic Prayers used at Mass.

B8D3E34293964D7EA8E35C7A1D039F6E.description:
Identify the two central parts of the Mass: Liturgy of the Word and
Liturgy of the Eucharist.

D24E6D4BA4FF48E5B362354B6157EFCD.description:
Articulate how participating in the prayer of the church (liturgy)
opens us to hear God’s voice.

343AD8BB06C24B24B67F69FF97DAE0D3.description:
Understand liturgy as the public worship central to the life of the
Church and has four parts: Introductory Rites, Liturgy of the Word,
Liturgy of the Eucharist, Concluding Rites.

711335AA30464418B5438FE75C004F23.description:
Eucharist
Who, how, when, and
where the Mass is
celebrated
[1135-1167, 1322-1419]
Scripture:
Gen. 15:1-21; 22:1-18
Ex. 2:1-10; 3:1-17; 12:1-
14; 20:3-11
Jn. 6:32:58
Heb. 7:1-28

2341E9BB4E47429EB76F92227F500199.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

98CF78A65F5947E0ACB13AEEECAF1875.description:
Recognize faith is a gift that calls us to believe and to follow the
teaching of our Church as stated in the creeds.

34B088F5A07E473184F91B168DE7451B.description:
Define the term “creed” as professions of belief and recall that the
Nicene Creed is recited at Mass and the Apostles Creed is part of the rosary.

2747CC31EC0641AD8182C7C2EA1A1C56.description:
Identify liturgical moments when they reverence the Trinity (i.e.
Holy Spirit called down upon the gifts of bread and wine.)

DFE763A8CD534DCAA606ECF065BCEDF9.description:
Articulate how the Church calls upon the Holy Spirit in each of the
Sacraments.

07DD0B0D71664E46A2496908AE5E7419.description: Pray for guidance to God the Holy Spirit.

C418A211E6064D4F85AAC593A9FD98DE.description:
Name Jesus as God the Son and Savior who is both human and
divine.

6CFB366C771F447692AA62F9D7F1CF9F.description: Identify Trinity in the Nicene and Apostles Creed.

6E43541BB84141FE9DBA3D2E0DFB680C.description:
Recognize that all three persons of the Trinity are present in all of
the Sacraments

DD3D2373339347A890F12F4F447ABB47.description:
TRINITY:
CREATOR,
REDEEMER,
SANCTIFIER
[249-324]
Scripture:
Gen. 1:1-31, 2:1-25

9A37F07E03EA4AEF9D0D67EC9BD4186A.description:
Articulate how each Sacrament helps them to see, celebrate and
live as Christ taught.

F682EB64FCA440689194360B2225C155.description:
Explain how Jesus, the Bread of Life, nourishes them in the
Eucharist.

3B5A9D8CB7974447A8ECFB395926934F.description: Articulate the significance of the miracle of the loaves and fishes.

F55DF82DD4DE4CCAB57D2889EB392550.description:
Describe the power of Jesus to heal and to forgive in the Sunday
Gospel.

7159EB28DC914F7B861926CF2F3843B8.description:
Identify and develop an understanding of Christ as portrayed in
the Sunday Gospel.

0B7054CF064B48A382EDD6A0E4C09C23.description:
Retell events from Salvation History that form the basis of our
sacramental life: Exodus Story, Passion and Death of Jesus

9C923F6A9B144837877B3402F41A91BC.description:
Associate God’s saving love throughout Salvation History with
our sacramental life.

C7CB9C2BFA9049C8B30BCB0F129430A1.description:
Identify psalms that are part of the Liturgy of the Hours, mornings
and evenings.

722CC5C755C848BBA445B5A6E8892751.description:
Articulate how frequent participation in the Sacraments
strengthens their Covenant relationship with God.

8CD7E2C75CB04982BE95658B23D637C7.description:
List the outward signs of each Sacrament and locate stories from
Scripture that refer to these liturgical elements, e.g. water, manna, oil, laying
on of hands, light.

088FD40A8CAE4574AFA1AD72F2F2A16D.description:
Recognize God continues to reveal Himself through apostolic
tradition.

BF0E27D2B8804C34A38571995A6F7F26.description:
Recognize that faith is a gift from God that calls us to respond to
His plan for us.

D1979C88CD064DDB8325A98694E008BF.description:
Identify ways God desires to reveal Himself to us in Scripture and
Tradition.

7B1E95410B6843D699BF9D08FB530A5D.description:
Define natural law and explain why all people are bound to observe
the natural law.

5DF0A4E87ED345F1BB53EE70B4032444.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1 – KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
